title: As Donald Trump Faces Impeachment, He Insists Ukraine Convo 'Made Up'
text:
Related:

Brad Pitt Rips President Donald Trump, Calls Him 'Threat' To US

Celebrities Pay Respect To Victims And First Responders On 9/11 Anniversary

President Trump's Fake Hurricane Map Spawns A Slew Of Hilarious Memes

Twitter War Erupts Between Debra Messing and President Trump Over Fundraiser

President Trump Launches Space Command ... Space Force is Next!

Calls For Impeachment

President Donald Trump, facing an impeachment inquiry, is tweeting again this morning. Trump now says the July 25 conversation he had with Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelenskyy in which he pressured Zelenskyy to investigate Hunter Biden is "made up."

Whistleblower Made Complaint Against Trump

The phone call was brought to officials' attention by a whistleblower who spoke up because he /she thought it was urgent, since the memo outlining the call states that Trump was asking Zelenskyy for a "favor" regarding the 2020 U.S. election.

"Rep. Adam Schiff totally made up my conversation with Ukraine President and read it to Congress and Millions," Trump tweeted, saying Schiff is a "sick man."

Trump Says Schiff Made It Up

Trump further said that Schiff, the Democratic chairman of the House Intelligence Committee, relayed a conversation to Congress "that doesn't exist."

"....he completely changed the words to make it sound horrible, and me sound guilty," the president said.

“HE WAS DESPERATE AND HE GOT CAUGHT. Adam Schiff therefore lied to Congress and attempted to defraud the American Public. He has been doing this for two years. I am calling for him to immediately resign from Congress based on this fraud!”

Historic Moment For America

So far, at least 218 House members say they are supporting a vote of impeachment.

Trump is just the fourth president in U.S. history who's faced an impeachment inquiry, so it's a rather momentous time for America. The nation will be watching to see what happens next.
